intro: Klasea centauroides var. albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and arid landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
